title: Crieff Travel script
content:
Does anyone recognise this script, thought it was Brody at first, but i can’t make it fit. Thanks in advance.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [crieff.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911195023/http:/typophile.com/files/crieff.jpg) | 35.01 KB |

 [‹ Big Caslon-like serif face on Penguin Books cover](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911195023/http:/typophile.com/node/29167 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) EventGuard, serif/uncial mix - Delphin {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911195023/http:/typophile.com/node/29205 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Tim Shaw

comments.content: I think it is Brody, just seriously stretched.

Thanks ill sans,

just tried brody again, it def does not fit, the top stroke of the T is quit short even before stretching Brody, the loop on the “L” is not close to Brody either.
I’ve seen a knock-off version of Brody called Louisville, but I can’t seem to find it on the internet (don’t mistake it with De Louisville). Maybe that one would fit?
